name: Celebrities with a Connection Trivia Quiz | Celebrity Connections | 15 Questions

questions.text: This young actor started out in movies like 'Space Camp' and 'Parenthood'. He now goes by his given name, but had used a nickname from age 4 because his elder siblings had earthy names like River and Rain.
questions.explanation:
Joaquin Phoenix.

	He went by Leaf Phoenix until the 1990s.

questions.text: This 'Pretty Woman' actress was paid $300,000 for her work in that movie. Her latest movie earned her a salary of $20,000,000!
questions.explanation:
Julia Roberts & Roberts.

	She changed her name from birth name Julie to Julia because there was already an existing actress named Julie Roberts.

questions.text: This woman, with her 34 Oscar nominations and 8 awards make her both the most honored costume designer and woman in Academy Award history to date.
questions.explanation:
Edith Head.

	She was costume designer for almost 400 movies, from 'Love Me Tonight'(1932, uncredited) to 'Dead Men Don't Wear Plaid' (1982).

questions.text: This man, actor in the 'Killer Tomatoes' movies (and writer of one), married a woman on national TV after holding a beauty pageant-style contest to select her.
questions.explanation:
Rick Rockwell.

	He was married to his TV bride, Darva Conger, from February 15th, 2000 to April 5th, 2000, when they got it annulled.

questions.text: Besides playing Rachel on the TV show 'Family Matters', she was part of Dawn as in Tony Orlando and Dawn.

This man trained as a doctor. He was persuaded several times not to quit the course but did so after qualifying. He instead has written novels, 20 of which have been turned into movies like 'Andromeda Strain' and 'Twister'. He also is the executive producer of TV's 'ER'.
This actress played Kirstie Alley's sister in Sibling Rivalry. She also guest stars on 'ER' as Dr. Nina Pomerantz, a former romantic interest of Dr. Greene.
This actress played Jo on 'Melrose Place' and Princess Vespa in 'Spaceballs'.

This businessman, a pioneer in the software industry, has been one of the
 wealthiest people in the world.
This actress has been nominated 4 times for Academy Awards for her work in : 'Testament', 'Kramer vs. Kramer', 'All the President's Men', and 'The Great White Hope'.
This man won the 1976 Olympic Decathalon.
This actress played Janine in the 'Ghostbuster' movies, and was the voice of Bo Peep in the 'Toy Story' movies.
This actress starred with Jim Carrey in 'Dumb and Dumber', and was married to him for about a year.
This actor has made a name playing hardball cops on 'NYPD Blue', 'Hill Street Blues', 'Die Hard 2' and 'Dressed to Kill'.
questions.explanation:
Dennis Franz.

	The big connection tying these celebrities together. They all share my birthday, October 28th.
